title: How to Outline and Border Text in Photoshop

steps.title: Open a new or existing Photoshop file.
steps.content: Open a new or existing Photoshop file.

steps.title: Select the text tool and insert your text.
steps.content: Select the text tool and insert your text . Customize your text to your liking. [1] X Research source You can center the text , change the text color , or use an added font .

steps.title: Click Type on the top toolbar.
steps.content: Click Type on the top toolbar. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Convert to Shape.
steps.content: Click Convert to Shape . [2] X Research source Alternatively, you can right-click the text layer in the Layers menu and select Convert to Shape .

steps.title: Select the Path Selection Tool.
steps.content: Select the Path Selection Tool. This will be the cursor icon filled in with black. [3] X Research source Points will appear and select your text outline.

steps.title: At the top of the page, click Fill and set it to "None".
steps.content: At the top of the page, click Fill and set it to "None". None is represented by the white box with a diagonal line running through.

steps.title: Set the stroke color and size.
steps.content: Set the stroke color and size. You can choose from Recently Used Colors or select from a saved palette. [4] X Research source To change the size, click the line icon and set the thickness. You can also manually input the size in pixels beside the thickness presets.

steps.title: Select the "Move" tool to see your new outline.
steps.content: Select the "Move" tool to see your new outline. If you need to make any adjustments, use the Path Selection Tool again. [5] X Research source If needed, you can resize the image or change the background color .
